questions.text: During recovery from anaesthesia, which of the following drugs is used for the reversal of neuromuscular blockade?

On examination neck rigidity is present and there is hip and knee flexion on passive flexion of the neck. A lumbar puncture was done and CSF findings are as shown below. What is your diagnosis? The child had a past history of weakness in both upper and lower limbs which improved with time. On examination, residual weakness is present more in the lower limbs and trunk as compared to the upper limbs. What is this condition called?

A study Is conducted to identify the association between vaccination and the development of a disease in a community. Based on the data, 6 vaccinated individuals and 12 unvaccinated individuals developed severe disease. Calculate the relative risk for this community.

Which is the most common neurological sequel of this condition that can develop?

questions.correct_answer: A. Blocking voltage gated sodium channels

questions.text: Child has developed recurrent lung infections with thickened sputum and CXR shows bronchial wall thickening. He has been suffering from steatorrhea since birth. Which of the following is first differential diagnosis?

A 40-year-old woman comes with complaints of fatigue which worsens towards the end of the day. She also complains of double vision while watching television. The physician suspects a case of myasthenia gravis. Which of the following tests has the highest sensitivity in diagnosing this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Acetylcholine receptor and muscle-specific receptor tyrosine kinase antibodies

questions.text: An 8-year-old girl presented with frequent episodes of staring spells in school. On further evaluation, she was diagnosed with absence seizures and started on ethosuximide. What is the mechanism of action of this drug? GABA: gamma-Aminobutyric acid

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of the T-type calcium channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibition of the T-type calcium channels

questions.text: A patient developed hand-foot syndrome after 10 days of initiation of chemotherapy. Which of the following is the most likely agent to cause this adverse effect?

A patient, who is a known case of HIV with a CD4 count of 200 cells/cu.mm, presents with a 5-day history of cough and high-grade fever without chills and rigors. There is no history of diarrhea, vomiting, or nuchal rigidity. Chest X-ray is normal. Which of the following will be the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
Morbidity of a disease is on the rise. Which of the following statements is correct with respect to this?

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence will increase and prevalence will decrease

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence and prevalence are not related to it

options.label: D
options.text: Incidence will decrease and prevalence will increase

questions.correct_answer: C. Incidence and prevalence will increase

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman presented with severe pain and swelling in her right hand which is increasing in size and severity. She had a prick injury while in the garden 5 days back. On examination, she cries out in pain when you try to extend the hand and palpate the palmar aspect passively. Which of the following statements is true about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more common on the dorsal aspect of the hand

options.label: B
options.text: X ray imaging will aid in location of the foreign body in all patients.

options.label: D
options.text: Oral analgesics are the mainstay of treatment

questions.correct_answer: C. It requires incision and drainage.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child with a sore throat develops skin lesions, as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely type of psoriasis in this patient?

A 10-year-old boy presents with complaints of nocturnal pruritus. Examination shows burrows over intertriginous areas, axilla, umbilicus, and in between the digits. Which of the following vectors is responsible for transmitting this disease?
A 5-year-old boy presented to the OPD with the findings. He had suffered a fall on an outstretched hand one year back. What is the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: An undisplaced supracondylar fracture of humerus

options.label: B
options.text: Malunion of a supracondylar fracture of humerus

questions.correct_answer: B. Malunion of a supracondylar fracture of humerus

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient came with pain in the left loin. An intravenous urogram was done and the image is shown below. There is non-visualisation of the right kidney. Which of the following is a true statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Visualized kidney has a remnant”function of 10%.

options.label: B
options.text: This abnormality can be due to compression of ureter by artery/vein on the same side

options.label: C
options.text: The best test to evaluate the functioning of a kidney is through a Tc99 DMSA scan

questions.correct_answer: B. This abnormality can be due to compression of ureter by artery/vein on the same side

questions.text: A patient came to OPD with a complaint of dilated and tortuous veins in the left leg and mild pain while walking. On palpation, the vein is pulsatile. He had a history of road traffic accident, including a left leg fracture 10 years ago. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male came to OPD with a complaint of midline neck swelling which has been persistent for many years. Recently, it has become painful and inflamed. There has been a clear watery discharge from the wound since last week. On examination, the swelling moves with protrusion of the tongue and also on deglutition. Which of the following statements is true about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Untreated condition may lead to squamous cell carcinoma

options.label: C
options.text: They are remnants of thyroid tissue

options.label: D
options.text: Acid fast bacilli (AFB) staining should be done to come to a diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: C. They are remnants of thyroid tissue

A patient is brought to the casualty following a road traffic accident. He is tachypneic and uses accessory neck muscles for respiration. His BP is 90/60 mm Hg. On percussion, the right chest is hyper-resonant. On auscultation, breath sounds could not be heard on the right chest. An urgent chest X-ray is done. What is the next best step of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Tube thoracostomy at 5th intercostal space anterior to mid-axillary line

options.label: B
options.text: Needle decompression at 5th intercostal space anterior to mid-axillary line

options.label: C
options.text: Needle decompression at 5th intercostal space in the mid-clavicular line

questions.correct_answer: B. Needle decompression at 5th intercostal space anterior to mid-axillary line

A 17-year-old male patient presents with dull aching pain over the back of his ankle. There is tenderness on firm palpation of the swelling. The following findings are seen on X-ray. What is the likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 26-year male presented to OPD with a deformity of the left hand. He had a past history of RTA in which he had injured the same limb 6 months back. There was hypothenar muscle atrophy and a fixed deformity where on opening his hand he is not able to extend the medial two fingers. Which of the following nerves is likely to be injured?

options.text: Vitamin K, fresh frozen plasma and neurosurgery consultation

questions.correct_answer: C. Urgent surgical exploration with ileostomy

questions.text: Which of the following biochemical parameters are consistent with osteoporosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Calcium and PTH increase, phosphate is normal and ALP decreases

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium and phosphate are normal, PTH increases and ALP decreases

questions.correct_answer: D. Calcium, phosphate, PTH, ALP all are normal

questions.correct_answer: B. It can progress to squamous cell cancer
